title: Riot fix your grading system. Very very broken
body:
I was a 2/14/3 Ashe. I got Grade B-. and my friend 11/5/17/ Master Yi, got grade C+.
Now how the possible fuck does that work???
What the actual fuck how does that even work

Riot not to point names but you might wanna check your grading system. I like what you're doing with the game currently though, doing well bringing out heaps of good shit.

replies.body:
It isn't a set score you need to achieve, it's all relative to how everyone else on the server is doing with the same champ in the same role.

From Riot:

> It’s based on the champion and role that you just played in a game. So, for example, we look at Annie mid differently to Annie support. We take a series of performance metrics and compare how you do to all other players in your region in your champion / position combination. It is percentile driven - so earning a high score means** you performed in the top x% of players** on that champ in that position. The grade itself governs the point gains.

[(Source)](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/page/features/champion-mastery)

[Basically grades similarly to a bell curve](http://study.com/academy/lesson/bell-curve-definition-impact-on-grades.html), meaning we have a server full of really good players. 

Riot hasn't released a list of the factors that contribute to a high grade, but I would suggest working on CS, objective assists, and possibly warding to bump up your grade that extra notch ♥
I guess you're right I still just think it's a tad weird that me feeding that much I deserve a D, just a bit weird.

Feed your way to S, and get those chests and keys!
You can do it, I believe in you.
Your first issue is that you somehow think KDA is even remotely relevant to how well a player performs in a given game. Let me tell you that KDA means nothing in the grand scheme of things.

It's all about how much farm you get, how little you die and partially how many kills you get. 
Keep in mind that these scores are also compared to other players, so with yi, 11/5/17 is actually pretty below average considering Yi's usually get a lot more kills.

Again though, just farm and you'll get S.
Idk why people can't understand the grading system is based on ranking, not scores :/
